remarks: Special case of ~ zndvds when one argument is zero.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
statement:
zncyg.y $e |- Y = ( Z/nZ ` N ) $.
zndvds.2 $e |- L = ( ZRHom ` Y ) $.
zndvds0.3 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` Y ) $.
zndvds0 $p |- ( ( N e. NN0 /\ A e. ZZ ) -> ( ( L ` A ) = .0. <-> N || A ) ) $.
